702661f-a.text:
24th Street, s.s., e. fr. Third Avenue, Brooklyn.
Neg. no. A-1323
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 21, 1940

702662f-b.text:
24th Street, east from Third Avenue. The buildings on both corners were torn down for the widening of Third Avenue which later became a link in the Belt Parkway system of highways. The steeple is that of the Church of Our Lady of Czestochowa.

View 1: October 17, 1940
View 2: April 21, 1941

P. L. Sperr

702662f-a.text:
24th Street, east from Third Avenue. The buildings on both corners were torn down for the widening of Third Avenue which later became a link in the Belt Parkway system of highways. The steeple is that of the Church of Our Lady of Czestochowa.

View 1: October 17, 1940
View 2: April 21, 1941

P. L. Sperr

702281f-c.text:
3rd Avenue, south from 24th to 26th Streets. The clearance on the east side of the avenue is for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway. Buildings on the west side of the avenue were left unmolested.

View 2 shows the Sullivan Dry Dock and Repair yard, formerly the Todd Shipyard, at the S.W. corner of 24th Street.
View 3 shows the S.W. corner of 25th Street.
October, 1940
Views 1, 2,3
P. L. Sperr

702280f-a.text:

Neg. no. A-1326
P. L. Sperr, photographer
